revised_title: Investigations on the Abnormal Outgrowths or Intumescences on Hibiscus vitifolius, Linn.: A Study in Experimental Plant Pathology
tldr: This study investigates the abnormal outgrowths, or intumescences, found on the leaves and young shoots of Hibiscus vitifolius, Linn. The research explores their anatomy, development, and the environmental factors that induce their formation, concluding that intumescences are pathological structures resulting from disturbances in the metabolic activity of the plant tissues.
